name: Frank J. NASCONE and Ross Park Center, Inc., Appellants, v. ROSS TOWNSHIP ZONING HEARING BOARD, Appellee, and Herbert L. Berie and Nancy Rose Berie, his wife, et al., and Township of Ross, Intervenors-Appellees
name_abbreviation: Nascone v. Ross Township Zoning Hearing Board

judges: Before NIX, C.J., and FLAHERTY, McDERMOTT and HUTCHINSON, JJ.
LARSEN, ZAPPALA and PAPADAKOS, JJ., did not participate in the consideration or decision of this case.
parties: Frank J. NASCONE and Ross Park Center, Inc., Appellants, v. ROSS TOWNSHIP ZONING HEARING BOARD, Appellee, and Herbert L. Berie and Nancy Rose Berie, his wife, et al., and Township of Ross, Intervenors-Appellees.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
Appeal dismissed as having been improvidently granted.
LARSEN, ZAPPALA and PAPADAKOS, JJ., did not participate in the consideration or decision of this case.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

attorneys: Frederick A. Boehm, Patrick J. Clair, Samuel P. Kamin, Pittsburgh, for appellants.
John M. Means, Charles M. Means, Pittsburgh, for appellee, Ross Tp. Zoning Hearing Bd.
James W. Dunn, Pittsburgh, for Herbert L. Berie, et ux., et al.
casebody.head_matter:
488 A.2d 1109
Frank J. NASCONE and Ross Park Center, Inc., Appellants, v. ROSS TOWNSHIP ZONING HEARING BOARD, Appellee, and Herbert L. Berie and Nancy Rose Berie, his wife, et al., and Township of Ross, Intervenors-Appellees.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued March 7, 1985.
Decided March 20, 1985.
Frederick A. Boehm, Patrick J. Clair, Samuel P. Kamin, Pittsburgh, for appellants.
John M. Means, Charles M. Means, Pittsburgh, for appellee, Ross Tp. Zoning Hearing Bd.
James W. Dunn, Pittsburgh, for Herbert L. Berie, et ux., et al.
Before NIX, C.J., and FLAHERTY, McDERMOTT and HUTCHINSON, JJ.
